scope.description: All web content of the desktop and mobile versions of "Members", located at https://members.csh.rit.edu/
scope.title: CSH Members Portal

defineScope.accessibilitySupportBaseline: The content of the site should be accessible via a screen reader (NVDA, VoiceOver, Narrator, etc.).  All content will be evaluated using Edge
defineScope.additionalEvaluationRequirements: The report will include a list of errors identified by the evaluator as well as improvement suggestions for how to make these errors accessible.

exploreTarget.essentialFunctionality: View and access links to all different internal Computer Science House services. As well as add visual stimulation and entertainment through "plugs" and images
exploreTarget.pageTypeVariety: Members consists of a singular landing page that links to multiple other pages through icons. There are two states of the site: icons showing and icons hidden.

result.description:
-Icons do not contain understandable ids or alt-text, but do have correlating names written out below 
-Plugs do not have alt-text

subject.description: All web content of the desktop and mobile versions of "Members", located at https://members.csh.rit.edu/
subject.title: CSH Members Portal

result.description:
Texts and backgrounds checked:
-White text on purple background passed at 6.5% contrast
-Gray icons on white background passed at 4.6% contrast (note that this only passes by 0.1%)
-Black text on cyan background passes at 16.74% contrast

subject.description: All web content of the desktop and mobile versions of "Members", located at https://members.csh.rit.edu/
subject.title: CSH Members Portal

result.description: The dropdown menu options below the first 2 items listed are inaccessible in 200% zoom. As well as in 100% zoom the longer dropdowns still have their items unable to be clicked on. All dropdowns need to have a scroll implemented or do not include dropdown menus

result.description: -The navigation tab dropdowns are inaccessable by both screen reader and tabulation+enter key actions. Only the first menu item (public site) is able to be focused on and interacted with. The rest of the menu items are read out but not able to access the dropdowns.

result.description: There is no way to pause, stop, or hide plugs or weird clock (the two automatically moving items. Suggestion to add a hide button to each element

subject.description: All web content of the desktop and mobile versions of "Members", located at https://members.csh.rit.edu/
subject.title: CSH Members Portal

result.description:
-Any moving/blinking/scrolling elements -aka plugs- must be approved by able human eyes before being implemented into circulation.  "Not seizure-inducing" is not part of the criteria for approving. There for, this fails because there is still a way for sizure inducing plugs to make it onto the UI without a warning.
-Bonus moving item, Wierd Clock, does in fact move less than 3 frames per second. There for no physical reactions are to be noted as not there

subject.description: All web content of the desktop and mobile versions of "Members", located at https://members.csh.rit.edu/
subject.title: CSH Members Portal

result.description: There are no multiple web pages so this is not applicable

subject.description: All web content of the desktop and mobile versions of "Members", located at https://members.csh.rit.edu/
subject.title: CSH Members Portal

subject.description: All web content of the desktop and mobile versions of "Members", located at https://members.csh.rit.edu/
subject.title: CSH Members Portal

result.description:
For the most part, the site has a meaningful order. The pain points are as listed:
-Weird clock is taking up too much screen real-estate and breaking the flow of reading. 
-Plug is not at the top like the majority of CSH services so it breaks cross-platform consistency
Suggestions:
-Move Weird Clock to the bottom or a minimized size under the vertical plug and/or move the link to a new "memes" or an otherly appropriately titled section.

subject.title: CSH Members Portal

result.description: Since this site's purpose is to link to other sites its worth noting that this accessibility point has passed with flying colors.

result.description:
Even with no internet or other tested erroring methods, no 404 or 500 or obvious errors that impaired the site's functionality appeared. 
So on one hand, no errors are being displayed, but no errors are being made to affect the site.

reportFindings.summary:
Overall, not bad. There are things to be worked on but the site is generally very usable, understandable, operable, and robust. Below are the list of failure to be worked--
1.1.1 Non-text Content - No alt text
1.4.4 Resize text - Dropdown menu elements unclickable
2.1.1 Keyboard - Navigation tabs inaccessible via screen reader or tabulation
2.2.2 Pause, Stop, Hide - Time-based or moving media is not able to be paused, stopped, or hidden.
2.3.1 Seizures and Physical Reactions - Plugs can induce seizures or physical reactions and have no warning if they do.
2.4.3 Focus Order - Plugs and weird clock disrupt the flow of usability.
3.1.2 Language of Parts - Icons need IDs

Unclear--
3.3.1 Error Identification - Error pages aren't heavily considered but no obvious errors are occurring.
reportFindings.title: CSH Members Portal Accessibility Report
reportFindings.evaluationSpecifics:
This evaluation utilized the following resources:
- Microsoft Edge (Version 10.14.6)
- Google Chrome (Version 90.0.4430.212) (Official Build) (x86_64)
- WAVE Web Accessibility Evaluation Tool (https://wave.webaim.org/)
- Windows VoiceOver Screen Reader
- W3C Markup Validation Service (https://validator.w3.org/)
-Color Shark (https://colorshark.io/)
